Chapter 36
FINANCE AND TAXATION
Sales Tax
36.01: SHORT TITLE:
This subchapter shall be known and may be cited as CITY OF WOODWARD SALES TAX ORDINANCE.
(2001 Code § 36.01)
36.02: DEFINITIONS:
The definitions of words, terms and phrases contained in the Oklahoma sales tax code, 68 Oklahoma Statutes
Section
Number
Description Bail Amount
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 62/395
sections 1352 and 1352.1, are hereby adopted by reference and made a part of this subchapter.
For the purpose of this subchapter, the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or
requires a different meaning:
SALE: Includes the sale, preparation or service of ice or nonalcoholic beverages that are sold, prepared or
served for the purpose of being mixed with alcoholic beverages for consumption on a premises where such
sale, preparation or service occurs.
TAX COLLECTOR: The department of the city government or the official agency of the state duly designated
according to law or contract authorized by law to administer the collection of the tax herein levied. (2001 Code
§ 36.02)
36.03: CLASSIFICATION OF TAXPAYERS:
For the purpose of this subchapter, the classification of taxpayers hereunder shall be prescribed by state law
for purposes of the Oklahoma sales tax code. (2001 Code § 36.03)
36.04: SUBSISTING STATE PERMITS:
All valid and subsisting permits to do business issued by the Oklahoma tax commission pursuant to the
Oklahoma sales tax code are, for the purpose of this subchapter, hereby ratified, confirmed and adopted in lieu
of any requirement for an additional city permit for the same purpose. (2001 Code § 36.04)
36.05: PURPOSE OF REVENUES:
It is hereby declared to be the purpose of this subchapter to provide revenues for the support of the functions
of the municipal government of the city. (2001 Code § 36.05)
36.06: TAX RATE; SALES SUBJECT TO TAX:
A. Rate; Sales Subject To Tax: There is hereby levied an excise tax of three percent (3%) upon the gross
proceeds or gross receipts derived from all sales taxable under the Oklahoma sales tax code, 68
Oklahoma Statutes section 1350 et seq., and as it may be amended, including, but not exclusive of, those
specified in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1354 et seq. (2001 Code § 36.06; amd. 2012 Code)
B. Additional Sales Tax; Purpose:
1. It is hereby declared that an additional 0.5 percent sales tax levied by this subchapter shall be in addition
to the other sales tax levied by this subchapter, and shall be used by the city or transferred to any public
trust of which the city is the beneficiary to be used for:
a. The wastewater collection, treatment and discharge system.
b. The stormwater collection and discharge system.
c. The potable water production, storage and distribution system.
d. Heavy equipment necessary for the construction of and maintenance of the wastewater, potable water
and stormwater systems.
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 63/395
e. Construct, reconstruct, improve and repair streets and bridges in the city, and such other and
additional capital expenditures as may be deemed necessary from time to time by the city commission;
and, provided, that the additional 0.5 percent sales tax provided for hereby shall cease to be levied
after March 31, 2029. (2001 Code § 36.06; amd. Ord. 1580, 6-3-2013, eff. 8-13-2013)
2. a. There is hereby imposed an excise tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (in addition to any and all
other excise taxes now in force) to be levied upon the gross proceeds or gross receipts derived from all
sales taxable under the Oklahoma sales tax code.
b. It is hereby declared to be the purpose of this subsection to provide revenues to be used for the
construction of a new Central Fire Station and completion of the 34th Street enhancement project, with
any excess proceeds used for general operation and maintenance expenses, all for the use and
benefit of the city and any public trust having the city as beneficiary thereof and/or for the payment of
debt service in connection with obligations issued to finance the Central Fire Station or the 34th Street
enhancement project.
c. The provisions of this subsection and the collection of the excise tax referenced herein shall become
effective on and after January 1, 2014, and shall terminate and cease to be levied after December 31,
2028. (Ord. 1581, 6-3-2013)
36.07: EXEMPTIONS:
There is hereby specifically exempted from the tax levied by this subchapter the gross receipts or gross
proceeds exempted from the sales tax law of Oklahoma, 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1355 et seq. (2001
Code § 36.07; amd. 2012 Code)
36.08: PAYMENT OF TAX; BRACKETS:
A. The tax levied hereunder shall be due and payable at the time and in the manner and form prescribed for
payment of the state sales tax under the sales tax law of the state.
B. 1. The tax herein levied shall be paid to the tax collector at the time and in the form and manner provided
for payment of state sales tax under the sales tax law of Oklahoma. (2001 Code § 36.08)
2. The bracket system for the collection of the city sales tax by the tax collector shall be the same as
hereafter adopted by the agreement of the city, and the tax collector, in the collection of both the city
sales tax and the state sales tax. (2001 Code § 36.08; amd. 2012 Code)
36.09: TAX CONSTITUTES DEBT:
Such taxes, penalty and interest due hereunder shall at all times constitute a prior, superior and paramount
claim as against the claims of unsecured creditors, and may be collected by suit as any other debt. (2001
Code § 36.09)
36.10: VENDOR'S DUTY TO COLLECT TAX:
A. The tax levied hereunder shall be paid by the consumer or user to the vendor, and it shall be the duty of
each and every vendor in this city to collect from the consumer or user the full amount of the tax levied by
this subchapter, or an amount equal as nearly as possible or practicable to the average equivalent thereof.
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 64/395
B. Vendors shall add the tax imposed hereunder, or the average equivalent thereof, to the sales price or
charge, and when added, the tax shall constitute a part of such price or charge, shall be a debt from the
consumer or user to the vendor until paid, and shall be recoverable at law in the same manner as other
debts.
C. A "vendor" as defined herein, who wilfully or intentionally fails, neglects or refuses to collect the full amount
of the tax levied by this subchapter, or wilfully or intentionally fails, neglects or refuses to comply with the
provisions or remits or rebates to a consumer or user, either directly or indirectly, and by whatsoever
means, all or any part of the tax herein levied, or makes in any form of advertising, verbally or otherwise,
any statement which infers that he is absorbing the tax, or paying the tax for the consumer or user by an
adjustment of prices or at a price including tax, or in any manner whatsoever, shall be deemed guilty of an
offense, and shall be subject to penalties as set forth in this subchapter. (2001 Code § 36.10)
36.11: RETURNS AND REMITTANCES; DISCOUNTS:
Returns and remittances of the tax herein levied and collected shall be made to the tax collector at the time
and in the manner, form and amount as prescribed for returns and remittances required by the state sales tax
code; and remittances of tax collected hereunder shall be subject to the same discount as may be allowed by
the state code for collection of state sales taxes. (2001 Code § 36.11)
36.12: INTEREST AND PENALTIES; DELINQUENCY:
The city hereby adopts 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 217 and makes it a part of this subchapter. Interest and
penalties at the rates and in amounts as therein specified are hereby levied and shall be applicable in cases of
delinquency in reporting and paying the tax levied by this subchapter; provided, that the failure or refusal of
any taxpayer to make and transmit the reports and remittances of tax in the time and manner required by this
subchapter shall cause such tax to be delinquent. In addition, if such delinquency continues for a period of five
(5) days, the taxpayer shall forfeit his claim to any discount allowed under this subchapter. (2001 Code
§ 36.12)
36.13: WAIVER OF INTEREST AND PENALTIES:
The interest or penalty, or any portion thereof, accruing by reason of a taxpayer's failure to pay the city tax
herein levied, may be waived or remitted in the same manner as provided for the waiver or remittance as
applied in administration of the state sales tax provided in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 220; and to
accomplish the purposes of this section, the applicable provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 220 are
hereby adopted by reference and made a part of this subchapter. (2001 Code § 36.13)
36.14: REFUND OF ERRONEOUS PAYMENTS:
A refund of an erroneous payment of the city sales tax herein levied may be made to any taxpayer making an
erroneous payment in the same manner and procedure, and under the same limitations of time, as provided
for administration of the state sales tax as set forth in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 227, and to accomplish
the purposes of this section, the applicable provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 227 are hereby
adopted by reference and made a part of this subchapter. (2001 Code § 36.14)
36.15: FRAUDULENT RETURNS:
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 65/395
In addition to all civil penalties provided by this subchapter, the wilful failure or refusal of any taxpayer to make
reports and remittances herein required, or the making of any false and fraudulent report for the purpose of
avoiding or escaping payment of any tax, or portion thereof, rightfully due under this subchapter shall be guilty
of an offense, and shall be subject to penalties as set forth in this subchapter. (2001 Code § 36.15)
36.16: RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL:
The confidential and privileged nature of the records and files concerning the administration of the city sales
tax is legislatively recognized and declared, and to protect the same, the provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes
section 205 of the state sales tax code, and each subsection thereof, are hereby adopted by reference and
made fully effective and applicable to administration of the city sales tax as if herein set forth in full. (2001
Code § 36.16)
36.17: AMENDMENTS:
The people of the city, by their approval of these provisions at the election provided by ordinance, hereby
authorize the city commission by duly enacted ordinances to make such administrative and technical changes
or additions in the method and manner of administration and enforcing this subchapter as may be necessary
or proper for efficiency and fairness, except that the rate of the tax herein provided shall not be changed
without the approval of the qualified electors of the city as provided by law. (2001 Code § 36.17)
36.18: PROVISIONS CUMULATIVE:
The provisions in this subchapter shall be cumulative and in addition to any and all other taxing provisions of
city ordinances. (2001 Code § 36.18)
Excise Tax
36.30: TITLE:
This subchapter shall be known and may be cited as CITY OF WOODWARD EXCISE TAX ORDINANCE.
(2001 Code § 36.30)
36.31: EXCISE TAX LEVIED:
A. Excise Tax On Storage, Use Or Other Consumption Of Tangible Personal Property Levied: There is hereby
levied and there shall be paid by every person storing, using or otherwise consuming within the
municipality tangible personal property purchased or brought into this municipality, an excise tax on the
storage, use or other consuming within the municipality of such property at the rate equal to the prevailing
total of all sales taxes levied by the municipality on the purchase price of such property. Such tax shall be
paid by every person storing, using or otherwise consuming, within the municipality, tangible personal
property purchased or brought into the municipality. The additional tax levied hereunder shall be paid at the
time of importation or storage of the property within the municipality and shall be assessed to only property
purchased outside Oklahoma; provided, that the tax levied herein shall not be levied against tangible
personal property intended solely for use outside the municipality, but which is stored within the
municipality pending shipment outside the municipality or which is temporarily retained in the municipality
for the purpose of fabrication, repair, testing, alteration, maintenance or other service. Any person liable for
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 66/395
payment of the tax authorized herein, may deduct from such tax any local or municipal sales tax previously
paid on such goods or services; provided, that the amount deducted shall not exceed the amount that
would have been due if the taxes imposed by the municipality had been levied on the sale of such goods or
services.
B. Automatic Change In Use Tax Rate Upon Change In Sales Tax Rate: The rate of excise tax levied pursuant
to this subchapter shall automatically adjust to match the prevailing sales tax rate levied by the
municipality, such change in use tax rate to be effective on the date the change in the prevailing sales tax
rate takes effect, and such change in use tax rate not requiring further approval of the governing body of
the municipality. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.32: EXEMPTIONS:
The provisions of this subchapter shall not apply:
A. In respect to the use of any article of tangible personal property brought into the municipality by a
nonresident individual, visiting in this municipality, for his or her personal use or enjoyment, while within the
municipality;
B. In respect to the use of tangible personal property purchased for resale before being used;
C. In respect to the use of any article of tangible personal property on which a tax, equal to or in excess of that
levied by both the Oklahoma use tax code and the city of Woodward use tax ordinance, has been paid by
the person using such tangible personal property in the municipality, whether such tax was levied under the
laws of Oklahoma or some other state or municipality of the United States. If any article of tangible
personal property has already been subjected to a tax by Oklahoma or any other state or municipality in
respect to its sale or use, in an amount less than the tax imposed by both the Oklahoma use tax code and
the city of Woodward use tax ordinance, the provisions of this subchapter shall also apply to it by a rate
measured by the difference only between the rate provided by both the Oklahoma use tax code and the
city of Woodward use tax ordinance, and the rate by which the previous tax upon the sale or use was
computed. Provided, that no credit shall be given for taxes paid in another state or municipality, if that state
or municipality does not grant like credit for taxes paid in Oklahoma and the municipality;
D. In respect to the use of machinery and equipment purchased and used by persons establishing new
manufacturing or processing plants in the municipality, and machinery and equipment purchased and used
by persons for the operation of manufacturing plants already established in the municipality. Provided, this
exemption shall not apply unless such machinery and equipment is incorporated into, and is directly used
in, the process of manufacturing property subject to taxation under the sales tax code of the municipality.
The term "manufacturing plants" shall mean those establishments primarily engaged in manufacturing or
processing operations, and generally recognized as such;
E. In respect to the use of tangible personal property now specifically exempted from taxation under the sales
tax code of the municipality;
F. In respect to the use of any article of tangible personal property brought into the municipality by an individual
with intent to become a resident of this municipality where such personal property is for such individual's
personal use or enjoyment;
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 67/395
G. In respect to the use of any article of tangible personal property used or to be used by commercial airlines
or railroads;
H. In respect to livestock purchased outside Oklahoma and brought into this municipality for feeding or
breeding purposes, and which is later resold;
I. In respect to the use of rail transportation cars to haul coal to coal fired plants located in this municipality
which generate electric power. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.33: TIME WHEN DUE; RETURNS; PAYMENT:
The tax levied by this subchapter is due and payable at the time and in the manner and form prescribed for
payment of the state use tax code of the state of Oklahoma. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.34: TAX CONSTITUTES DEBT:
Such taxes, penalty, and interest due hereunder shall at all times constitute a prior, superior and paramount
claim as against the claims of unsecured creditors, and may be collected by suit as any other debt. (Ord. 1591,
9-23-2013)
36.35: COLLECTION OF TAX BY RETAILER OR VENDOR:
Every retailer or vendor maintaining places of business both within and without the state of Oklahoma, and
making sales of tangible personal property from a place of business outside this state for use in this
municipality shall at the time of making such sales collect the use tax levied by this subchapter from the
purchaser and give to the purchaser a receipt therefor in the manner and form prescribed by the tax
commission, if the tax commission shall, by regulation, require such receipt. Each retailer or vendor shall list
with the tax commission the name and address of all its agents operating in this municipality and location of
any and all distribution or sales houses or offices or other places of business in this city. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-
2013)
36.36: COLLECTION OF TAX BY RETAILER OR VENDOR NOT MAINTAINING A PLACE
OF BUSINESS WITHIN STATE OR BOTH WITHIN AND WITHOUT STATE; PERMITS:
The tax commission may, in its discretion, upon application, authorize the collection of the tax herein levied by
any retailer or vendor not maintaining a place of business within this state but who makes sales of tangible
personal property for use in this municipality and by the out of state place of business of any retailer or vendor
maintaining places of business both within and without Oklahoma and making sales of tangible personal
property at such out of state place of business for use in this municipality. Such retailer or vendor may be
issued without charge, a permit to collect such taxes, by the tax commission in such manner and subject to
such regulations and agreements as it shall prescribe. When so authorized, it shall be the duty of such retailer
or vendor to collect the tax upon all tangible personal property sold to his knowledge for use within this
municipality. Such authority and permit may be canceled when at any time the tax commission considers that
such tax can more effectively be collected from the person using such property in this municipality. Provided,
however, that in all instances where such sales are made or completed by delivery to the purchaser within this
municipality by the retailer or vendor in such retailer's or vendor's vehicle, whether owned or leased (not by
common carrier), such sales or transactions shall continue to be subject to applicable municipality sales tax at
the point of delivery and the tax shall be collected and reported under taxpayer's sales tax permit number
accordingly. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 68/395
36.37: REVOKING PERMITS:
Whenever any retailer or vendor not maintaining a place of business in this state, or both within and without
this state, and authorized to collect the tax herein levied, fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
subchapter or the Oklahoma use tax code or any order, rules or regulations of the tax commission, the tax
commission may, upon notice and hearing as provided for in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1408, 2011, by
order revoke the use tax permit, if any, issued to such retailer or vendor, and if any such retailer or vendor is a
corporation authorized to do business in this state may, after notice and hearing above provided, cancel said
corporation's license to do business in this state and shall issue a new license only when such corporation has
complied with the obligations under this subchapter, the Oklahoma use tax code, or any order, rules or
regulations of the tax commission. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.38: REMUNERATIVE DEDUCTIONS ALLOWED VENDORS OR RETAILERS OF OTHER
STATES:
Returns and remittances of the tax herein levied and collected shall be made to the tax commission at the time
and in the manner, form and amount as prescribed for returns and remittances required by the Oklahoma use
tax code; and remittances of tax collected hereunder shall be subject to the same discount as may be allowed
by said code for the collection of state use taxes. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.39: INTEREST AND PENALTIES; DELINQUENCY:
68 Oklahoma Statutes section 217, 2011, is hereby adopted and made a part of this subchapter, and interest
and penalties at the rates and in the amounts as therein specified are hereby levied and shall be applicable in
cases of delinquency in reporting and paying the tax levied by this subchapter. Provided, that the failure or
refusal of any retailer or vendor to make and transmit the reports and remittances of tax in the time and
manner required by this subchapter shall cause such tax to be delinquent. In addition, if such delinquency
continues for a period of five (5) days, the retailer or vendor shall forfeit his claim to any discount allowed
under this subchapter. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.40: WAIVER OF INTEREST AND PENALTIES:
The interest or penalty or any portion thereof accruing by reason of a retailer's or vendor's failure to pay the
municipality tax herein levied may be waived or remitted in the same manner as provided for said waiver or
remittance as applied in administration of the state use tax provided in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 220,
2011, and to accomplish the purpose of this section, the applicable provisions of said section 220 are hereby
adopted by reference and made a part of this subchapter. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.41: ERRONEOUS PAYMENTS; CLAIM FOR REFUND:
Refund of erroneous payment of the municipality use tax herein levied may be made to any taxpayer making
such erroneous payment in the same manner and procedure, and under the same limitations of time, as
provided for administration of the state use tax as set forth in 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 227, 2011, and to
accomplish the purpose of this section, the applicable provisions of said section 227 are hereby adopted by
reference and made a part of this subchapter. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.42: FRAUDULENT RETURNS:
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 69/395
In addition to all civil penalties provided by this subchapter, the wilful failure or refusal of any taxpayer to make
reports and remittances herein required, or the making of any false and fraudulent report for the purpose of
avoiding or escaping payment of any tax or portion thereof rightfully due under this subchapter shall be an
offense, and upon conviction thereof the offending taxpayer shall be punished by a fine of not more than one
hundred dollars ($100.00) and costs. Each day of noncompliance with this subchapter shall constitute a
separate offense. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.43: RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL:
The confidential and privileged nature of the records and files concerning the administration of the municipality
use tax is legislatively recognized and declared, and to protect the same the provisions of 68 Oklahoma
Statutes section 205, 2011, of the state use tax code, and each subsection thereof, is hereby adopted by
reference and made fully effective and applicable to administration of the municipal use tax as is herein set
forth in full. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.44: PROVISIONS CUMULATIVE:
The provisions hereof shall be cumulative, and in addition to any and all other taxing provisions of the
municipality's ordinances. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.45: PROVISIONS SEVERABLE:
The provisions hereof are hereby declared to be severable, and if any section, paragraph, sentence or clause
of this subchapter is for any reason held invalid or inoperative by any court of competent jurisdiction, such
decision shall not affect any other section, paragraph, sentence or clause hereof. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.46: DEFINITIONS:
The definitions of words, terms and phrases contained in the Oklahoma use tax code, 68 Oklahoma Statutes
section 1401, 2011, are hereby adopted by reference and made a part of this subchapter. In addition thereto,
the following words and terms shall be defined as follows:
CITY OR MUNICIPALITY: The city of Woodward, Oklahoma.
TRANSACTION: Sale. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.47: TAX COLLECTOR DEFINED:
The term "tax collector" as used herein means the department of the municipality government or the official
agency of the state, duly designated according to law or contract authorized by law, to administer the collection
of the tax herein levied. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.48: CLASSIFICATION OF TAXPAYERS:
For the purpose of this subchapter, the classification of taxpayers hereunder shall be as prescribed by state
law for purposes of the Oklahoma use tax code. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)

https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 70/395
36.49: SUBSISTING STATE PERMITS:
All valid and subsisting permits to do business issued by the tax commission pursuant to the Oklahoma use
tax code are for the purpose of this subchapter hereby ratified, confirmed and adopted in lieu of any
requirement for an additional municipality permit for the same purpose. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.50: PURPOSES OF REVENUES:
It is hereby declared to be the purpose of this subchapter to provide revenues for the support of the functions
of the municipal government of the municipality and any and all revenues derived hereunder may be expended
by the governing body of the municipality for any purposes for which funds may be lawfully expended as
authorized. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.51: CITATION AND CODIFICATION:
This subchapter shall be known and may be cited as CITY OF WOODWARD USE TAX ORDINANCE and
shall be codified as no. 1591 of the ordinances of the city. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
36.52: SUPERSEDENCE OF PRIOR ORDINANCES:
Upon the effective date of this subchapter, this subchapter shall supersede and replace in all respects any
prior ordinance(s) of the city levying a use tax in the manner set forth in section 36.31 of this chapter. (Ord.
1591, 9-23-2013)
36.53: EMERGENCY:
This subchapter shall take effect immediately and all members of the board of commissioners concur in said
effective date and declare an emergency because this subchapter relates to the preservation of the public
peace, health, and safety of the inhabitants of the city of Woodward, Oklahoma. (Ord. 1591, 9-23-2013)
Hotel Tax
36.60: TITLE:
This subchapter shall be known and cited as the WOODWARD HOTEL ROOM TAX ORDINANCE. (2001
Code § 36.60)
36.61: DEFINITIONS:
For the purpose of this subchapter, the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or
requires a different meaning:
COMMITTEE: The Woodward convention and visitors bureau.
DIRECTOR: The city clerk of Woodward, or a duly authorized agent of the city clerk.
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 71/395
HOTEL: Any building or buildings, structures, trailer or other facility in which the public may, for consideration,
obtain sleeping accommodations in which three (3) or more rooms are used for the accommodation of such
"guests", whether the rooms are in one or several structures. The term shall include hotels, apartment hotels,
motels, tourist homes, bed and breakfast inns, houses or courts, lodging houses, inns, rooming houses, trailer
houses, trailer motels, dormitory space where bed space is rented to individuals or groups, apartments not
occupied by permanent residents, and all other facilities where rooms or sleeping facilities or spaces are
furnished for a consideration. The term shall not include hospitals, sanatoriums or nursing homes.
OCCUPANCY: The use or possession, or the right to the use or possession, of any room or rooms in a hotel,
or the right to the use or possession of the furnishings or to the services and accommodations accompanying
the use and possession of the room or rooms.
OCCUPANT: A person who, for a consideration, uses, possesses or has the right to the use or possession of
any room or rooms in a hotel, under any lease, concession, permit, right to access, license to use, or other
agreement.
OPERATOR: A person or legal entity operating a hotel in this city, including, but not limited to, the owner,
proprietor, lessee, sublessee, mortgagee in possession, court appointed receiver, trustee in bankruptcy,
licensee, or any other person otherwise operating such hotel.
RENT: The consideration received for occupancy valued in money, whether received in money or otherwise,
including all receipts, cash, credits and property or services of any kind or nature, and also any amount for
which credit is allowed by the operator to the occupant, without any deduction therefrom whatsoever.
RETURN: Any return filed or required to be filed as herein provided.
ROOM: Any room or rooms of any kind in any part or portion of a hotel which is available for or let out for use
or possessed for any purpose other than a place of assembly. As used herein, "place of assembly" means a
room or space which is legally capable under this code of being occupied by seventy five (75) or more persons
and which is used for educational, recreational or amusement purposes and shall include dance halls,
cabarets, nightclubs, restaurants, any room or space for public or private banquets, feasts, social, card parties
or weddings, lodge and meeting halls or rooms, skating rinks, gymnasiums, swimming pools, billiard, bowling
and table tennis rooms, halls or rooms used for public or private catering purposes, funeral parlors, markets,
recreational rooms, concert halls, broadcasting studios, and all other places of similar type of occupancy.
TAX: The tax levied pursuant to this subchapter. (2001 Code § 36.61; amd. Ord. 1524, 3-7-2011; Ord. 1615, 5-
4-2015)
36.62: TAX RATE:
There is hereby levied an excise tax of six percent (6%) upon the gross proceeds or gross receipts derived
from all rent for every occupancy of a room or rooms in a hotel in this city, except that the tax shall not be
imposed where the rent is less than the rate of three dollars ($3.00) per day. (2001 Code § 36.62)
36.63: EXEMPTIONS:
A. Specified: The following guests shall be exempt from the tax levied in this subchapter: (Ord. 1615, 5-4-
2015)
1. (Rep. by Ord. 1615, 5-4-2015)
2. Representatives of the United States government or any agency or division thereof while on official
business.
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 72/395
3. Representatives of the state of Oklahoma or any political subdivision thereof while on official business.
B. Documentation Required: Every operator shall document the basis for which exemptions are made
pursuant to this section on a form provided by the director, or if no form is provided, in sufficient detail as to
be verified by audit by the director. (2001 Code § 36.63)
36.64: TAX TO BE SEPARATELY DESIGNATED ON BILLS:
The operator shall separately designate, charge and show the tax on all bills, statements, receipts, or any
other evidence of charges or payment of rent for occupancy issued or delivered by the operator. (2001 Code
§ 36.64)
36.65: OPERATOR RESPONSIBLE FOR COLLECTION:
The operator shall be responsible for the collection of the tax from the occupant and shall be liable to the city
for the tax. (2001 Code § 36.65)
36.66: RECORDS TO BE KEPT:
Every operator shall keep records of every occupancy and of all rent paid, charged or due thereon and of the
tax payable thereon in such form as the director may by regulations require. Such records shall be available
for inspection and examination at any time upon demand by the director, or a duly authorized agent or
employee of the city, and shall be preserved for a period of three (3) years. (2001 Code § 36.66)
36.67: RETURNS:
A. Every operator shall file with the director a return of occupancy and of rents and of the taxes payable
thereon within thirty (30) days from the periods ending March 31, June 30, September 30 and December
31 of each year. If the payment date falls on a day the office of the city clerk is closed, the payment period
shall run to the next regular business day the office of the city clerk is open for business.
B. The director may permit or require returns to be made by shorter or longer periods and upon such dates as
he may specify. The form of return shall be prescribed by the director and shall contain such information as
he may deem necessary for the proper administration of this subchapter. The director may require
amended returns to be filed within twenty (20) days after notice and to contain the information specified in
the notice. (2001 Code § 36.67)
36.68: PAYMENT OF TAX:
At the time of filing a return of occupancy and of rents, each operator shall pay to the director the taxes
imposed by this subchapter upon the rents included in such return, as well as all other monies collected by the
operator acting or purporting to act under the provisions of this subchapter. All the taxes for the period for
which a return is required to be filed shall be due from the operator and payable to the director on or before the
date fixed for the filing of the return for such period without regard to whether a return is filed or whether the
return which is filed correctly shows the amount of rents and the taxes due thereon. (2001 Code § 36.68)
36.69: BOND REQUIRED:
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 73/395
Where the director believes that any operator is about to cease business, leave the state, or remove or
dissipate assets, or for any other similar reason he deems it necessary in order to protect revenues under this
subchapter, he may require the operator to file with the city a bond issued by a surety company authorized to
transact business in this state in such amount as the director may fix to secure the payment of any tax or
penalties and interest due, or which may become due from the operator. In the event that the director
determines that an operator is to file such bond, he shall give notice to the operator specifying the amount of
bond required. The operator shall file the bond within five (5) days after the delivery or mailing of such notice
unless, within the five (5) days, the operator shall request in writing a hearing before the city commission or its
designee, at which time the propriety and amount of the bond shall be determined by the city commission or its
designee. Such determination shall be final and shall be complied with within fifteen (15) days thereafter. In
lieu of such bond, securities approved by the director, or cash in such amount as he may prescribe, may be
deposited with the director. The director may at any time after five (5) days' notice to the operator, apply the
bond, cash or other security to any tax or penalties due and for that purpose the securities may be sold at
private or public sale. (2001 Code § 36.69)
36.70: ASSESSMENT AND DETERMINATION OF TAX:
If a return required by this subchapter is not filed, or if a return when filed is incorrect or insufficient, the
amount of tax due shall be assessed by the director from such information as may be obtainable and, if
necessary, the tax may be estimated on the basis of external indices, such as number of rooms, location,
scale of rents, comparable rents, types of accommodations and services, number of employees, or other
factors. Written notice of such assessments shall be delivered to the office of the hotel. Such assessment shall
finally and irrevocably fix and determine the tax unless the person or entity against whom it is assessed, within
thirty (30) days after the giving of notice of such assessment, shall apply in writing to the city commission or its
designee for a hearing or unless the director on his own motion shall reassess the same. After such hearing,
the city commission or its designee shall give written notice of its determination to the person or entity against
whom the tax is assessed and such determination shall be final. (2001 Code § 36.70)
36.71: REFUNDS:
A. Procedure: The director shall refund or credit any tax erroneously collected if written application to the
director for the refund shall be made within two (2) years from the date of payment. For like causes, and in
the same period, a refund may be so made upon the initiative and the order of the director. Whenever a
refund is made, the reasons therefor shall be stated in writing. The application may also be made by the
person who has collected and paid such tax to the director; providing, that the application is made within
two (2) years of the payment of the occupant to the operator, but no refund of money shall be made to the
operator until he has repaid to the occupant the amount for which the application for refund is made. The
director, in lieu of any refund required to be made, may allow credit therefor on payment due from the
applicant.
B. Determination And Hearing: Upon application for a refund, the director may receive evidence with respect
thereto, and make such investigation as he deems necessary. After making a determination as to the
refund, the director shall give notice thereof to the applicant. The determination shall be final unless the
applicant, within ninety (90) days after such notice, shall apply in writing to the city commission for a
hearing. After the hearing, the city commission shall give written notice of its decision to the applicant.
(2001 Code § 36.71)
36.72: NOTICES:
Notices provided for under this subchapter shall be deemed to have been given when notice has been
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 74/395
delivered personally to the operator or deposited in the United States mail to the last known address of the
operator. (2001 Code § 36.72)
36.73: REMEDIES EXCLUSIVE:
The remedies provided in this subchapter shall be exclusive remedies available to any person for the review of
tax liability imposed by this subchapter. (2001 Code § 36.73)
36.74: GENERAL POWERS OF THE DIRECTOR:
In addition to all other powers granted to the director, he is hereby authorized and empowered:
A. To make, adopt and amend rules and regulations appropriate to the carrying out of this subchapter for the
purposes thereof.
B. To extend for cause shown the time for filing return for a period not exceeding sixty (60) days; and for cause
shown to waive, remit or reduce penalties or interest.
C. To delegate his functions hereunder to an assistant or other employee or employees of the city.
D. To assess, reassess, determine, revise and readjust the taxes imposed by this subchapter.
E. To prescribe methods for determining the taxable and nontaxable rents. (2001 Code § 36.74)
36.75: ADMINISTRATION OF OATHS; COMPELLING TESTIMONY:
The director shall have the power to administer oaths; subpoena and require the attendance of witnesses, the
production of books, papers and documents; and take affidavits in relation to any matter or proceeding in the
exercise of the powers and duties of the director or city commission under this subchapter. (2001 Code
§ 36.75)
36.76: CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION:
Every operator shall file with the director a certificate of registration in a form prescribed by the director within
three (3) days after commencement or opening. The director shall, within five (5) days after such registration,
issue, without charge, to each operator a certificate of authority empowering such operator to collect the tax
from the occupant and duplicates thereof for each additional hotel. Each certificate of authority shall be
permanently displayed by the operator in such manner that it may be seen and comes to the notice of all
occupants and persons seeking occupancy. Such certificates shall be nonassignable and nontransferable and
shall be surrendered immediately to the director upon the cessation of business at the hotel named, or upon its
sale or transfer. (2001 Code § 36.76)
36.77: DELINQUENT TAXES:
The tax levied by this subchapter shall be due and payable at the time filing of the returns provided for in this
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 75/395
subchapter is required. All taxes not paid within five (5) business days from the time they become due shall be
delinquent. (2001 Code § 36.77)
36.78: INTEREST AND PENALTIES:
A. If any tax levied or assessed by this subchapter becomes delinquent, the person or entity responsible and
liable for such tax shall pay a penalty equal to ten percent (10%) of the unpaid tax and interest on such
unpaid tax and penalty shall accrue at the rate of one and one-half percent (11/2%) per month on the
unpaid balance from the date of delinquency.
B. The city may bring a civil suit to enforce payment of any past due tax levied or assessed pursuant to this
subchapter in addition to conviction hereunder. (2001 Code § 36.78)
36.79: DISCOUNTS:
A. In order to remunerate an operator for keeping tax records, filing reports and remitting taxes when due, a
three percent (3%) discount shall be allowed on the total taxes paid prior to the time the tax becomes
delinquent.
B. This discount shall not apply to delinquent taxes or interest payments. (2001 Code § 36.79)
36.80: USE OF FUNDS:
All taxes collected pursuant to the provision of this subchapter shall be set aside and paid over to the
Woodward convention and visitors bureau, which shall have the duty to encourage, promote and foster
tourism, conventions and special events, and promote investment in facilities for the development of
conventions, tourism and special events within the city, and for no other purpose. (Ord. 1524, 3-7-2011)
36.81: RESERVED:
36.82: RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL:
The confidential and privileged nature of the records and files concerning the administration of the hotel tax is
legislatively recognized and declared, and to protect the same, the provisions of 68 Oklahoma Statutes section
205 of the state sales tax code, and each subsection thereof, are hereby adopted by reference and made fully
effective and applicable to administration of the city hotel room tax as if herein set forth. (2001 Code § 36.82)
36.83: FRAUDULENT RETURNS:
The wilful failure or refusal of any taxpayer to make reports and remittances therein required, or the making of
any false and fraudulent report for the purpose of avoiding or escaping payment of any tax, or portion thereof,
rightfully due under this subchapter shall be an offense and, upon conviction thereof, the offending taxpayer
shall be subject to a fine of not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00), including costs. Each day is to be
considered a separate offense to be charged severally. (2001 Code § 36.83)
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 76/395
36.84: AMENDMENTS:
The people of Woodward, by their approval of this subchapter at the election provided by ordinance, hereby
authorize the city commission by ordinances duly enacted to make such administrative and technical changes
or additions in the method and manner of administration and enforcement of this subchapter as may be
necessary or proper for the efficiency and fairness, except that the rate of the tax herein provided shall not be
changed without approval of the qualified electors of the city as provided by law. (2001 Code § 36.84)
36.85: PROVISIONS CUMULATIVE:
The provisions of this subchapter shall be cumulative, and in addition to any and all other taxing provisions of
city ordinances. (2001 Code § 36.85)
36.86: ADMINISTRATION FEE:
The city is authorized by this section to deduct a sum from this specially collected tax to use for the costs of
collection and administration, equal to ten percent (10%) of the total revenue accruing from the tax over an
annual collection period. (2001 Code § 36.86)
36.87: NULLIFICATION AND DISCHARGE OF DUTIES:
A. This tax is levied exclusively for the purpose of financing a committee of the city, for the purpose of the
convention and visitors development of the city, and the term of this tax shall be directly and totally
dependent upon the existence of said committee. If for any reason the agreements from which the
committee derives its existence are nullified or revoked, or for any reason are held to be no longer the
governing principles of the committee, the collection and/or disbursement of the revenues from this tax
shall cease immediately, provided, the city shall honor all their existing and lawful commitments of said
committee. (Ord. 1524, 3-7-2011)
B. The revenues of the tax created by this subchapter are for the sole and singular source of funding for the
committee created herein. If for any reason or act of any party or parties, the funding of the committee shall
be either partially or totally reduced, whether it be a temporary or permanent state, all parties charged with
responsibilities relating to the administration of the committee shall be discharged from any and all
responsibilities whether they be creations of ordinance or contract. (2001 Code § 36.87)
36.88: EFFECTIVE DATE:
This subchapter shall become and be effective on June 1, 2008, with approval of a majority of the registered
voters of the city voting on same in the manner prescribed by the code of the city and applicable state law,
both inclusive. The tax provided for in this subchapter shall be applicable to hotel rooms rented for June 1,
2008, and all subsequent days. (2001 Code § 36.88)
Penalty
36.99: PENALTY:
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 77/395
Any person, firm or corporation who shall violate any of the provisions of this chapter, or fail to comply
therewith or with any of the requirements thereof, shall be guilty of an offense and, upon conviction, shall be
punished by a fine of not more than two hundred dollars ($200.00). Each day upon which a violation continues
shall be deemed a separate offense. (2001 Code § 36.99)
Chapter 37
MUNICIPAL FACILITIES
Municipal Library
37.01: WOODWARD PUBLIC LIBRARY:
The city shall own and operate the Woodward Public Library. (2001 Code § 37.01)
37.02: WOODWARD PUBLIC LIBRARY BOARD:
A. Created: There is hereby created a Woodward public library board. (2001 Code § 37.02)
B. Duties: The library board shall act in an advisory capacity to the city commission and city manager in
planning, maintaining, equipping, operating, regulating and protecting the Woodward Public Library. (2001
Code § 37.02; amd. 2012 Code)
C. Membership; Appointment: The board shall consist of five (5) members, to be appointed by the mayor and
approved by the city commission.
D. Term Of Office; Removal; Vacancies: Directors appointed to the library board shall hold office for a term of
three (3) years from May 1 following their appointment, and their terms shall be staggered. The municipal
governing body may remove any director for misconduct or neglect of duty. Vacancies in the library board
of directors shall be filled in the same manner as original appointments.
E. Officers: Each year the board shall elect one of its number as chairperson, one member as secretary, and
by electing such other officers as the board may deem necessary.
F. Meetings: The board shall determine the time and place of its regular meetings. Special meetings of the
board may be called by the chairperson or by a majority of the board.
G. Bylaws And Regulations: The board shall adopt such bylaws and library regulations as may be necessary,
not inconsistent with city or state laws, and subject to approval of the city commission.
H. Budget; Annual Report: The library board shall, prior to April 30 of each year, present an itemized requested
budget for the next fiscal year to the city manager; and on or before July 31 of each year, submit its annual
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 78/395
report to the city commission stating:
1. The condition of its trust on June 30 of that year;
2. The various sums of money and property received from the library fund and other sources, and how
such monies have been expended and for what purposes;
3. The budget for the library for the next fiscal year;
4. Statistics on the general character and number of books and periodicals which:
a. Are on hand;
b. Are lost or missing;
c. Have been added by purchase, gift or otherwise during the year; and
d. Have been loaned out during the year.
5. The number of persons making use of the library during the year; and
6. Such other information, statistics and suggestions as it may deem of general interest.
I. Compensation: No compensation for the services of the board shall be allowed to any member thereof.
J. Removal: Any member of the board may be removed for good cause by a majority vote of the city
commission. Good cause shall include, but not be limited to, neglect of duties, failure to regularly attend
board meetings, and missing three (3) consecutive board meetings. (2001 Code § 37.02)
37.03: LIBRARY FUNDS:
All funds received by the board on account of the operation of the library, or otherwise, shall be paid by the
board to the city clerk, who shall deposit the same in the general fund. (2001 Code § 37.03; amd. 2012 Code)
37.04: DONATIONS:
Any person desiring to make donations of money, personal property or real property for the benefit of the
Woodward Public Library, or for the establishment, maintenance or endowment of public lectures in connection
with the library upon any subject designated by the donor in the field of literature, science and the arts (except
that lectures in the interest of any political party, politics or sectarian religion are expressly prohibited) shall
have the right to vest the title to such money or property in the city, to be held and controlled by the city, when
accepted, according to the terms of the donation. The city shall be held and considered to be a special trustee
as to such property or money donated. (2001 Code § 37.04)
Plains Indians And Pioneer Museum
37.15: PLAINS INDIANS AND PIONEER MUSEUM:
A. The city shall own and operate and/or lease the Plains Indians And Pioneer Museum.
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=872 79/395
B. The Plains Indians And Pioneer Museum board of directors shall act in an advisory capacity to the city

(2001 Code § 37.15; amd. 2012 Code)
Woodward Senior Citizen Center
37.25: WOODWARD SENIOR CITIZEN CENTER:
The city shall own and operate or lease the Woodward Senior Citizen Center. (2001 Code § 37.25)
37.26: WOODWARD SENIOR CITIZEN CENTER BOARD:
A. Created: There is hereby created the Woodward senior citizen center board, to act in an advisory capacity
to the city commission and city manager in planning, establishing, developing, constructing, enlarging,
improving, maintaining, equipping, operating, regulating and protecting the senior citizen center facilities
now or hereafter owned by the city.
B. Membership; Appointment: The board shall consist of five (5) members to be appointed by the mayor and
approved by the city commission.
C. Term; Vacancies: Each member shall be appointed for a term of three (3) years on a staggered term basis.
At the first regular meeting of the board, the members shall cast lots for respective terms of one year, two
(2) years, and three (3) years; thereafter the terms of the members shall be three (3) years. Appointments
shall be made the first Monday of each January, as needed. Vacancies on the board shall be filled by the
mayor and city commission only for the unexpired term of the member whose vacancy is being filled.
D. Officers: Each year, the board shall elect one of its number as chairperson, another as vice chairperson,
and another as secretary.
E. Meetings: The board shall determine the time and place of its regular meetings. Special meetings of the
board may be called by the chairperson or by a majority of the board.
F. Bylaws And Regulations: The board shall adopt such bylaws and regulations as may be necessary, not
inconsistent with city or state laws, and subject to approval of the city commission.
G. Compensation: No compensation for the services of the board shall be allowed to any member thereof.
H. Removal: Any member may be removed for good cause by majority vote of the city commission. Good
cause shall include, but not be limited to, neglect of duties, failure to regularly attend board meetings, and
missing three (3) consecutive board meetings. (2001 Code § 37.26)
Woodward Memorial Hospital
37.40: WOODWARD MEMORIAL HOSPITAL:
7/9/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.

The city shall own and operate, or lease, the Woodward Memorial Hospital. (2001 Code § 37.40)
Leasing Of City Property
37.50: LEASING OF CITY PROPERTY:
